meanings.definition: A person who sets type for printing.
meanings.sent1: The typesetters worked diligently to prepare the text for printing.
meanings.sent2: The typesetters at the printing press carefully arranged the letters for the newspaper.
meanings.sent3: The typesetters had a race to see who could set the type the fastest.
meanings.sent4: In the world of publishing, typesetters are the architects of the written word.
meanings.sent5: The typesetters' precision and skill brought the book to life on the page.

meanings.definition: The act or process of setting type for printing.
meanings.sent1: Typesetters require attention to detail to ensure the text is accurately arranged.
meanings.sent2: The typesetters' job involves arranging letters and characters for printing.
meanings.sent3: During the typesetters' lunch break, the letters on the page started dancing around.
meanings.sent4: The typesetters' work is like assembling a puzzle of words and sentences.
meanings.sent5: The art of typesetting transforms words into beautifully printed pages.
